AI/ML Engineer: Develops machine learning models using Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, and works with data for pattern recognition and automation.
Data Scientist: Performs data analysis using statistics, machine learning, Python, and tools like Pandas, NumPy, and Jupyter.
Web Developer: Builds websites and web apps using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React, and backend frameworks like Node.js or Django.
Android Developer: Creates Android apps using Java/Kotlin, Android Studio, and integrates with APIs and databases.
iOS Developer: Builds iOS applications using Swift, Xcode, and Apple SDKs for various mobile use cases.
Full Stack Developer: Handles both frontend and backend using React, Node.js, Express, and databases like MongoDB or PostgreSQL.
Frontend Developer: Focuses on UI/UX and builds the client side of web apps using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and frontend frameworks.
Backend Developer: Builds APIs and server logic using Python, Java, Node.js, and handles databases and integrations.
DevOps Engineer: Automates deployment and manages CI/CD pipelines with Docker, Kubernetes, Jenkins, AWS, and GitOps.
Cybersecurity Analyst: Monitors systems for threats, manages firewalls, handles security audits, and uses tools like Wireshark and Splunk.
Cloud Engineer: Designs and maintains cloud infrastructure on AWS, Azure, or GCP including VMs, storage, and networking.
Network Engineer: Maintains network infrastructure, configures routers/switches, and ensures reliable data communication.
Database Administrator: Designs and maintains databases like MySQL, PostgreSQL, or Oracle, handles backups, and optimizes queries.
Data Analyst: Extracts insights using SQL, Excel, Power BI, Tableau, and supports business decisions with reports.
Business Analyst: Bridges business needs with technical teams, gathers requirements, and creates user stories and documentation.
Project Manager: Plans, executes, and delivers projects using tools like Jira, Asana, Agile/Scrum methodologies.
UI/UX Designer: Designs intuitive user interfaces using Figma, Adobe XD, and conducts user testing and wireframing.
Graphic Designer: Creates visual content using Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign for digital and print media.
Content Writer: Writes blogs, product descriptions, and technical documents with focus on SEO and readability.
Technical Writer: Creates clear documentation, API docs, manuals using Markdown, DITA, and documentation platforms.
Mechanical Engineer: Designs mechanical systems, uses CAD software, performs simulations and works with materials.
Civil Engineer: Supervises construction, works with AutoCAD, STAAD Pro, manages infrastructure projects.
Electrical Engineer: Works with circuits, PCB design, embedded systems, and electrical equipment.
Electronics Engineer: Designs and tests electronic systems and hardware using microcontrollers and digital logic.
Embedded Systems Engineer: Programs microcontrollers using C/C++, works with real-time systems and IoT devices.
System Administrator: Manages servers, user accounts, system configurations, and scripting using Bash or PowerShell.
Digital Marketer: Runs campaigns, SEO, SEM, social media marketing, and analytics using tools like Google Ads, Hubspot.
HR Manager: Handles recruitment, employee engagement, payroll, and HR tools like Workday or SAP.
Fashion Designer: Creates apparel and accessories using design tools and knowledge of fashion trends and textiles.
Biotech Researcher: Conducts lab experiments, analyzes data in genetics, molecular biology, and uses lab tools.
Legal Associate: Works on contracts, legal research, client management, and compliance documentation.
Finance Analyst: Performs financial forecasting, valuation models, Excel, and tools like Bloomberg or Power BI.
Supply Chain Analyst: Optimizes logistics, inventory, procurement using SAP, Excel, and analytics tools.
Game Developer: Builds video games using Unity or Unreal Engine, C#/C++, and 3D modeling tools.
Product Manager: Defines product roadmap, gathers feedback, coordinates with design/dev teams, and analyzes KPIs.
